entry.et: Middle English abilite, from Anglo-French, from Latin habilitat-, habilitas, from habilis apt, skillful able

def.dt: :the quality or state of being able ability of the soil to hold water
:physical, mental, or legal power to perform
:natural aptitude or acquired proficiency children whose abilities warrant higher education

entry.et: Middle English -abilite, -ibilite, from Anglo-French -abilité, -ibilité, from Latin -abilitas, -ibilitas, from -abilis, -ibilis -able + -tas -ty

def.dt: :capacity, fitness, or tendency to act or be acted on in a (specified) way agglutinability
